chunks.en: Is having cold hands in winter a sign of kidney deficiency?
These past few days the temperature has been several degrees below zero, and my hands are as cold as steel.
Is this a sign of kidney deficiency? What's an effective way to regulate it?

Cold hands = less heat dissipation. Hot hands = more heat dissipation. When heat production is constant, less heat dissipation = body temperature protection. More heat dissipation = body temperature decreases. Vasoconstriction = less heat dissipation. Vasodilation = increased heat dissipation. Drinking alcohol = vasodilation. So when you drink alcohol in the winter, you feel very hot, but in reality, you are prone to hypothermia. When heat production is constant, and the ambient temperature is low, cold hands indicate that your body is reducing heat dissipation to maintain core temperature, which is precisely normal bodily function.

Therefore, how to keep your hands and feet warm is to increase heat production. The body's heat production is determined by various factors, such as basal metabolism. For example, the more skeletal muscle you have, the higher your basal metabolism will be.
Kidney deficiency is just a money-grabbing scheme.

I've had cold hands and feet since I was a child. After a physical examination last year, I went to a top-tier hospital to see a doctor, who said: If you believe in traditional Chinese medicine, I'll give you a prescription to take long-term. If you go to a TCM hospital, they'll probably say you have kidney deficiency and prescribe something similar.
If you don't believe in it, I'll tell you, you're not sub-healthy, the data from your kidney function evaluation are normal, you just dissipate less heat, it's completely individual.
Kidney deficiency for men, uterus cold for women ğŸ˜…

1. Wear more clothes 2. Eat more. If that doesn't work, it could be 1. Kidney yang deficiency 2. A problem with the Ying and Wei Qi (e.g., blockage in the middle) 3. Spleen and stomach problems 4. Meridian problems. See a reputable TCM doctor, and never treat yourself. (Write your own good prescription, take it, and die). They might give you Chinese medicine, moxibustion, acupuncture, or medicinal patches.
Although I'm against traditional Chinese medicine.
But TCM has survived to this day, and it's not so primitive that it can diagnose based solely on a single symptom.
If you go to a TCM hospital, the doctor will also ask you if you have other symptoms and do things like 'inspection, auscultation and olfaction, inquiry, and palpation'.
So whether you believe in TCM or not, don't ask about your health problems online, and don't take medicine to regulate yourself.
Even if TCM is unreliable, at the very least it's based on experience, which is better than unlicensed enthusiasts doing random research.
If someone doesn't acknowledge this, it can only mean that they themselves don't believe in TCM.
It's a fallen angel (doge)
Yes, see a TCM doctor

chunks.en: Can we be a bit more scientific... Who wouldn't have cold hands when it's several degrees below zero and they're not moving... If you were carrying bricks, would you be cold?
Turn on the air conditioning.
It's just poor blood circulation.
The kidneys are only one factor, it seems that cardiovascular function is more important.
In practice, if you eat too little dinner, you're more likely to be cold in the winter. Eating a full, warm meal solves this problem.

Go for a run, if you get warm while running, then you don't have kidney deficiency, which means that sprinting cures kidney deficiency. Run 20 kilometers without supplements, and your hands start to get cold, which means that long-distance running is bad for the kidneys doge

Located in Jiangsu, last December there was a particularly cold spell. When I returned to my place at night, my hands were so frozen that I couldn't stand it. I suspected that my body wasn't working properly, until I bought a space heater. After turning it on for about half an hour, the ambient temperature nearby rose. Not to mention my hands, I took off my shoes and wore slippers, it was so comfortable. Of course, as the temperature increased, the electricity bills also went up. On the last day of the 7-day no-reason return policy, I returned it. I bought dozens of disposable hand warmers, and the effect was pretty good. I recommend buying them on Pinduoduo, they are much cheaper than on Jingdong.

Cold hands and feet, excluding external clothing, the direct cause is that the blood flow to the hands and feet is too small, which means that the heart's pumping strength is weak, so you can enhance cardiovascular function, which is HIT or interval running.
If you want to use TCM to explain it, it means that the heart yang can't reach the whole body, because the heart is fire, and basically all the heat in the body depends on it.
Western medicine often makes the body colder the more it's treated, which is obviously problematic.
The heart yang cannot be transmitted, maybe the heart yang itself is very weak, one is that the yang cannot circulate to the whole body.

The heart is like a car engine, and liver blood is the fuel. Insufficient liver blood can also lead to insufficient heart yang, which prevents it from being transmitted, or the lung metal is not cool enough. The purpose of clearing the lungs is to cool the engine so that the engine can run at higher speeds.
So the problem must be viewed dialectically, to see what the syndrome is, and adjust according to the syndrome.
I used to have it too. After taking Seal Oil Pills for two years, it basically stopped happening.
It's because you don't have the heating on at home.
The conductivity constitution will go up.
Walk two kilometers outdoors, and see if your hands are still cold...
